channel.title: üè¢ University of Oxford on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Oxford on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Almost Surely Asymptotically Constant Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Many graph neural networks (GNNs) surprisingly converge to constant outputs with increasing graph size, limiting their expressiveness.

item.title: An exactly solvable model for emergence and scaling laws in the multitask sparse parity problem
item.description: A novel multilinear model analytically explains the emergence and scaling laws of skills in the multitask sparse parity problem, accurately predicting skill emergence in neural networks.

item.title: Artificial Generational Intelligence: Cultural Accumulation in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Reinforcement learning agents achieve emergent cultural accumulation by balancing social and independent learning, outperforming single-lifetime agents.

item.title: Bayesian Optimization of Functions over Node Subsets in Graphs
item.description: GraphComBO efficiently optimizes functions defined on node subsets within graphs using Bayesian Optimization. It tackles challenges posed by combinatorial complexity and computationally expensive fun…

item.title: Can Learned Optimization Make Reinforcement Learning Less Difficult?
item.description: Learned optimizer OPEN tackles RL’s non-stationarity, plasticity loss, and exploration using meta-learning, significantly outperforming traditional and other learned optimizers.

item.title: CountGD: Multi-Modal Open-World Counting
item.description: COUNTGD: A new multi-modal model counts objects in images using text or visual examples, significantly improving open-world counting accuracy.

item.title: Deep Bayesian Active Learning for Preference Modeling in Large Language Models
item.description: BAL-PM, a novel active learning approach, drastically reduces human feedback in LLM preference modeling by leveraging both model uncertainty and prompt distribution diversity, achieving 33%-68% fewer …

item.title: Direct3D: Scalable Image-to-3D Generation via 3D Latent Diffusion Transformer
item.description: Direct3D: Revolutionizing image-to-3D generation with a scalable, native 3D diffusion model achieving state-of-the-art quality.

item.title: Ensemble sampling for linear bandits: small ensembles suffice
item.description: Small ensembles in stochastic linear bandits achieve near-optimal regret; a rigorous analysis shows that ensemble size need only scale logarithmically with horizon.

item.title: FilterNet: Harnessing Frequency Filters for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: FilterNet: A novel deep learning architecture using learnable frequency filters for superior time series forecasting accuracy and efficiency.

item.title: G2D: From Global to Dense Radiography Representation Learning via Vision-Language Pre-training
item.description: G2D: a novel medical VLP framework achieves superior performance in medical image analysis by simultaneously learning global and dense visual features using image-text pairs without extra annotations.

item.title: Interpreting Learned Feedback Patterns in Large Language Models
item.description: Researchers developed methods to measure and interpret the divergence between learned feedback patterns (LFPs) in LLMs and human preferences, helping minimize discrepancies between LLM behavior and tr…

item.title: Learning on Large Graphs using Intersecting Communities
item.description: Learn on massive graphs efficiently using Intersecting Community Graphs (ICGs)! This method approximates large graphs with ICGs, enabling linear time/memory complexity for node classification.

item.title: Learning Segmentation from Point Trajectories
item.description: This paper introduces a novel unsupervised video object segmentation method using long-term point trajectories and optical flow, outperforming prior art by effectively combining sparse, long-term moti…

item.title: LoCo: Learning 3D Location-Consistent Image Features with a Memory-Efficient Ranking Loss
item.description: LoCo: Memory-efficient location-consistent image features learned via a novel ranking loss, enabling three orders of magnitude memory improvement and outperforming state-of-the-art.

item.title: Marginal Causal Flows for Validation and Inference
item.description: Frugal Flows: Generate realistic causal benchmarks with exact marginal causal effects, enabling robust causal method validation.

item.title: No-regret Learning in Harmonic Games: Extrapolation in the Face of Conflicting Interests
item.description: Extrapolated FTRL ensures Nash equilibrium convergence in harmonic games, defying standard no-regret learning limitations.

item.title: On the Limitations of Fractal Dimension as a Measure of Generalization
item.description: Fractal dimension, while showing promise, fails to consistently predict neural network generalization due to hyperparameter influence and adversarial initializations; prompting further research.

item.title: Once Read is Enough: Domain-specific Pretraining-free Language Models with Cluster-guided Sparse Experts for Long-tail Domain Knowledge
item.description: This research introduces Cluster-guided Sparse Experts (CSE), enabling pretrained language models to effectively learn long-tail domain knowledge without domain-specific pretraining, thus achieving su…

item.title: OxonFair: A Flexible Toolkit for Algorithmic Fairness
item.description: OxonFair: a new open-source toolkit for enforcing fairness in binary classification, supporting NLP, Computer Vision, and tabular data, optimizing any fairness metric, and minimizing performance degra…

item.title: Pre-trained Text-to-Image Diffusion Models Are Versatile Representation Learners for Control
item.description: Pre-trained text-to-image diffusion models create highly effective, versatile representations for embodied AI control, surpassing previous methods.

item.title: Principled Bayesian Optimization in Collaboration with Human Experts
item.description: COBOL: a novel Bayesian Optimization algorithm leverages human expert advice via binary labels, achieving both fast convergence and robustness to noisy input, while guaranteeing minimal expert effort.

item.title: Random Representations Outperform Online Continually Learned Representations
item.description: Random pixel projections outperform complex online continual learning methods for image classification, challenging assumptions about representation learning.

item.title: SpatialPIN: Enhancing Spatial Reasoning Capabilities of Vision-Language Models through Prompting and Interacting 3D Priors
item.description: SpatialPIN boosts vision-language models’ spatial reasoning by cleverly combining prompting techniques with 3D foundation models, achieving zero-shot performance on various spatial tasks.

item.title: Stability and Generalizability in SDE Diffusion Models with Measure-Preserving Dynamics
item.description: D¬≥GM, a novel score-based diffusion model, enhances stability & generalizability in solving inverse problems by leveraging measure-preserving dynamics, enabling robust image reconstruction across dive…

item.title: Towards Learning Group-Equivariant Features for Domain Adaptive 3D Detection
item.description: GroupEXP-DA boosts domain adaptive 3D object detection by using a grouping-exploration strategy to reduce bias in pseudo-label collection and account for multiple factors affecting object perception i…

item.title: Unsupervised Object Detection with Theoretical Guarantees
item.description: First unsupervised object detection method with theoretical guarantees to recover true object positions, up to quantifiable small shifts!

item.title: What Makes and Breaks Safety Fine-tuning? A Mechanistic Study
item.description: Safety fine-tuning for LLMs is shown to minimally transform weights, clustering inputs based on safety, but is easily bypassed by adversarial attacks.
